revised_title: Evolution and Classification of Labyrinthodont Amphibia
tldr: The author examines the evolution of labyrinthodonts, a group of amphibians that flourished from the Upper Devonian period to the Rhaetic. They discuss the various species and their geographical distribution, focusing on the skull and palate changes over time. The study provides insights into the age and environment of these ancient creatures and helps determine the horizons of the rocks in which they were found.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vertebrate Paleobiology
